problem_text:
A quasigroup is a groupoid Q(·) in which the equations ax = b and ya = b have a unique solution for any a, b ∈ Q. Two quasigroups Q(·) and Q(◦) are isotopic if there are bijections α, β, γ of the set Q onto itself such that x ◦ y = γ(αx · βy) for all x, y ∈ Q. It is well-known that all quasigroups that are isotopic to groups form a variety G. Let V be a variety of quasigroups. Characterize the class of groups isotopic to quasigroups in G ∩ V. For which identities characterizing V is every group isotopic to a quasigroup in G ∩ V? Under what conditions on V does any group isotopic to a quasigroup in G ∩ V consist of a single element?
V. D. Belousov, A. A. Gvaramiya
answer: Every part is answered (A. A. Gvaramiya, Dep. no. 6704-V84, VINITI, Moscow, 1984 (Russian)).
